019package org.tquadrat.foundation.config;
020
021import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.METHOD;
022import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.CLASS;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024
025import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
026import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
027import java.lang.annotation.Target;
028
029import org.apiguardian.api.API;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter;
032
033/**
034 *  <p>{@summary This annotation indicates that the property for the annotated
035 *  getter is initialised from an environment variable with the given
036 *  name.}</p>
037 *  <p>The initialisation uses the default
038 *  {@link StringConverter}
039 *  for the type of the property if none is provided; if there is no default
040 *  String converter, an error is thrown during compile time.</p>
041 *  <p>Changing the configuration property value will not have an effect to
042 *  the environment variable.</p>
043 *  <p>This annotation implies the
044 *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.config.NoPreference}
045 *  annotation.</p>
046 *
047 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
048 *  @version $Id: EnvironmentVariable.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $
049 *  @since 0.0.1
050 *
051 *  @see System#getenv(String)
052 */
053@SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
054@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: EnvironmentVariable.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $" )
055@Documented
056@Retention( CLASS )
057@Target( METHOD )
058@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.2" )
059public @interface EnvironmentVariable
060{
061        /*------------*\
062    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
063        \*------------*/
064    /**
065     *  <p>{@summary The default value for the environment variable.} It will
066     *  be used for the initialisation of the property if the environment
067     *  variable is not set.</p>
068     *  <p>It is mandatory to provide a default value for primitive type
069     *  properties.</p>
070     *  <p>The default setting is a String containing only a {@code NUL}; it
071     *  will be treated as _null</p>
072     *
073     *  @return The default value.
074     */
075    public String defaultValue() default "\0";
076
077    /**
078     *  The name for the environment variable to read.
079     *
080     *  @return The name for the environment variable.
081     */
082    String value();
083}
084//  annotation EnvironmentVariable
085
086/*
087 *  End of File
088 */
